messages.title: UKIP says YES to
messages.content: An NHS free at the point of delivery; No tax on the minimum wage; Housing priority for local people; Affordable energy.

messages.title: UKIP says NO to
messages.content: Unlimited immigration; £55m a day membership fees to the EU; £12 billion a year in foreign aid; The 'bedroom tax' and the 'mansion tax'.

messages.title: The Truth About UKIP
messages.content: Keep the NHS free at point of delivery; An Australian-style, points based, fairer immigration system; No tax on the minimum wage, no 'bedroom' tax, no inheritance tax.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Pledge an extra £3 billion to the NHS to keep it free at the point of delivery.
Promises no tax on the minimum wage and to not implement the 'bedroom tax' or 'mansion tax'.
Aims to build more social and low-cost housing on existing sites not green fields and help young first-time buyers.
Invest in affordable energy from shale gas and nuclear, not over-subsidised wind and solar farms.
Advocacy for an Australian-style, points based, fairer immigration system.
Opposes the UK spending £55m a day on EU membership fees.
Proposes cutting foreign aid from £12 billion a year, focusing on water and fighting diseases, not subsidising regimes like those in India and China.

issues.brexitEurope: Favors leaving the EU to save £55m a day membership fees, as the EU is seen as the past, not the future.
issues.economy: Intends to oppose the 'bedroom tax' and the 'mansion tax', and suggests the benefit to taxpayers through reduced foreign aid spending and EU membership fees.
issues.environment: Supports investment in shale gas and nuclear energy.
issues.governance: Suggests the old parties are lying about UKIP, indicating a call for change in governance.
issues.health: Will invest an extra £3 billion in the NHS to keep it free.
issues.immigration: Promotes an Australian-style, points based, fairer immigration system to reduce pressure on health, housing, and fewer jobs for children.
issues.socialWelfare: Against 'bedroom tax' which affects social welfare.

housing.content: Aims to build more social and low-cost housing on existing sites not green fields and help young first-time buyers get on the housing ladder.

quotes.text: 'The old parties are lying about UKIP and its policies. They are running scared and don't want you to know the truth. Well, here it is...'

images.caption: Image of UKIP's campaign leaflet featuring key messages and policies, and a picture of the party leader.
